choices.text:
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request. ### Instruction: How do you align a row of divs to the right using flex in css? Show me an example. ### Response: To align a row of div elements to the right, we can use CSS Flexbox by setting `display:flex` and `justify-content:flex-end` properties on the parent container element. Here's an example code snippet that demonstrates this: ```html
Div 1
Div 2
Div 3
``` ```css .container { display: flex; justify-content: flex-end; /* aligns the divs to the right */ } ``` This will create a row of three div elements, with each element aligned to the right edge of its container using Flexbox.
